text: 2 In addition to what has been already said of Catherine Morland ’s personal and mental endowments , when about to be launched into all the difficulties and dangers of a six weeks ’ residence in Bath , it may be stated , for the reader ’s more certain information , lest the following pages should otherwise fail of giving any idea of what her character is meant to be , that her heart was affectionate ; her disposition cheerful and open , without conceit or affectation of any kind — her manners just removed from the awkwardness and shyness of a girl ; her person pleasing , and , when in good looks , pretty — and her mind about as ignorant and uninformed as the female mind at seventeen usually is .

text: A thousand alarming presentiments of evil to her beloved Catherine from this terrific separation must oppress her heart with sadness , and drown her in tears for the last day or two of their being together ; and advice of the most important and applicable nature must of course flow from her wise lips in their parting conference in her closet .
text_tokenized: A thousand alarming presentiments of evil to her beloved Catherine from this terrific separation must oppress her heart with sadness , and drown her in tears for the last day or two of their being together ; and advice of the most important and applicable nature must of course flow from her wise lips in their parting conference in her closet .

text: Cautions against the violence of such noblemen and baronets as delight in forcing young ladies away to some remote farm - house , must , at such a moment , relieve the fulness of her heart .
text_tokenized: Cautions against the violence of such noblemen and baronets as delight in forcing young ladies away to some remote farm - house , must , at such a moment , relieve the fulness of her heart .

text: But Mrs. Morland knew so little of lords and baronets , that she entertained no notion of their general mischievousness , and was wholly unsuspicious of danger to her daughter from their machinations .
text_tokenized: But Mrs. Morland knew so little of lords and baronets , that she entertained no notion of their general mischievousness , and was wholly unsuspicious of danger to her daughter from their machinations .

text: Her cautions were confined to the following points .

text: “ I beg , Catherine , you will always wrap yourself up very warm about the throat , when you come from the Rooms at night ; and I wish you would try to keep some account of the money you spend ; I will give you this little book on purpose .

text: Sally , or rather Sarah ( for what young lady of common gentility will reach the age of sixteen without altering her name as far as she can ? ) , must from situation be at this time the intimate friend and confidante of her sister .

text: It is remarkable , however , that she neither insisted on Catherine ’s writing by every post , nor exacted her promise of transmitting the character of every new acquaintance , nor a detail of every interesting conversation that Bath might produce .

text: Everything indeed relative to this important journey was done , on the part of the Morlands , with a degree of moderation and composure , which seemed rather consistent with the common feelings of common life , than with the refined susceptibilities , the tender emotions which the first separation of a heroine from her family ought always to excite .
text_tokenized: Everything indeed relative to this important journey was done , on the part of the Morlands , with a degree of moderation and composure , which seemed rather consistent with the common feelings of common life , than with the refined susceptibilities , the tender emotions which the first separation of a heroine from her family ought always to excite .

text: Her father , instead of giving her an unlimited order on his banker , or even putting an hundred pounds bank - bill into her hands , gave her only ten guineas , and promised her more when she wanted it .
text_tokenized: Her father , instead of giving her an unlimited order on his banker , or even putting an hundred pounds bank - bill into her hands , gave her only ten guineas , and promised her more when she wanted it .

text: Under these unpromising auspices , the parting took place , and the journey began .
text_tokenized: Under these unpromising auspices , the parting took place , and the journey began .

text: It was performed with suitable quietness and uneventful safety .
text_tokenized: It was performed with suitable quietness and uneventful safety .

text: Neither robbers nor tempests befriended them , nor one lucky overturn to introduce them to the hero .
text_tokenized: Neither robbers nor tempests befriended them , nor one lucky overturn to introduce them to the hero .

text: Nothing more alarming occurred than a fear , on Mrs. Allen ’s side , of having once left her clogs behind her at an inn , and that fortunately proved to be groundless .
text_tokenized: Nothing more alarming occurred than a fear , on Mrs. Allen ’s side , of having once left her clogs behind her at an inn , and that fortunately proved to be groundless .

text: They arrived at Bath .
text_tokenized: They arrived at Bath .

text: Catherine was all eager delight — her eyes were here , there , everywhere , as they approached its fine and striking environs , and afterwards drove through those streets which conducted them to the hotel .
text_tokenized: Catherine was all eager delight — her eyes were here , there , everywhere , as they approached its fine and striking environs , and afterwards drove through those streets which conducted them to the hotel .

text: She was come to be happy , and she felt happy already .
text_tokenized: She was come to be happy , and she felt happy already .

text: They were soon settled in comfortable lodgings in Pulteney Street .
text_tokenized: They were soon settled in comfortable lodgings in Pulteney Street .

text: It is now expedient to give some description of Mrs. Allen , that the reader may be able to judge in what manner her actions will hereafter tend to promote the general distress of the work , and how she will , probably , contribute to reduce poor Catherine to all the desperate wretchedness of which a last volume is capable — whether by her imprudence , vulgarity , or jealousy — whether by intercepting her letters , ruining her character , or turning her out of doors .
text_tokenized: It is now expedient to give some description of Mrs. Allen , that the reader may be able to judge in what manner her actions will hereafter tend to promote the general distress of the work , and how she will , probably , contribute to reduce poor Catherine to all the desperate wretchedness of which a last volume is capable — whether by her imprudence , vulgarity , or jealousy — whether by intercepting her letters , ruining her character , or turning her out of doors .

text: Mrs. Allen was one of that numerous class of females , whose society can raise no other emotion than surprise at there being any men in the world who could like them well enough to marry them .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Allen was one of that numerous class of females , whose society can raise no other emotion than surprise at there being any men in the world who could like them well enough to marry them .

text: She had neither beauty , genius , accomplishment , nor manner .
text_tokenized: She had neither beauty , genius , accomplishment , nor manner .

text: The air of a gentlewoman , a great deal of quiet , inactive good temper , and a trifling turn of mind were all that could account for her being the choice of a sensible , intelligent man like Mr. Allen .
text_tokenized: The air of a gentlewoman , a great deal of quiet , inactive good temper , and a trifling turn of mind were all that could account for her being the choice of a sensible , intelligent man like Mr. Allen .

text: In one respect she was admirably fitted to introduce a young lady into public , being as fond of going everywhere and seeing everything herself as any young lady could be .
text_tokenized: In one respect she was admirably fitted to introduce a young lady into public , being as fond of going everywhere and seeing everything herself as any young lady could be .

text: Dress was her passion .
text_tokenized: Dress was her passion .

text: She had a most harmless delight in being fine ; and our heroine ’s entree into life could not take place till after three or four days had been spent in learning what was mostly worn , and her chaperon was provided with a dress of the newest fashion .

text: With such encouragement , Catherine hoped at least to pass uncensured through the crowd .

text: As for admiration , it was always very welcome when it came , but she did not depend on it .
text_tokenized: As for admiration , it was always very welcome when it came , but she did not depend on it .

text: Mrs. Allen was so long in dressing that they did not enter the ballroom till late .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Allen was so long in dressing that they did not enter the ballroom till late .

text: The season was full , the room crowded , and the two ladies squeezed in as well as they could .

text: As for Mr. Allen , he repaired directly to the card - room , and left them to enjoy a mob by themselves .

text: With more care for the safety of her new gown than for the comfort of her protégée , Mrs. Allen made her way through the throng of men by the door , as swiftly as the necessary caution would allow ; Catherine , however , kept close at her side , and linked her arm too firmly within her friend ’s to be torn asunder by any common effort of a struggling assembly .
text_tokenized: With more care for the safety of her new gown than for the comfort of her protégée , Mrs. Allen made her way through the throng of men by the door , as swiftly as the necessary caution would allow ; Catherine , however , kept close at her side , and linked her arm too firmly within her friend ’s to be torn asunder by any common effort of a struggling assembly .

text: But to her utter amazement she found that to proceed along the room was by no means the way to disengage themselves from the crowd ; it seemed rather to increase as they went on , whereas she had imagined that when once fairly within the door , they should easily find seats and be able to watch the dances with perfect convenience .
text_tokenized: But to her utter amazement she found that to proceed along the room was by no means the way to disengage themselves from the crowd ; it seemed rather to increase as they went on , whereas she had imagined that when once fairly within the door , they should easily find seats and be able to watch the dances with perfect convenience .

text: “ Yes , my dear , ” replied Mrs. Allen , with perfect serenity , “ it is very uncomfortable indeed . ”

text: The company began to disperse when the dancing was over — enough to leave space for the remainder to walk about in some comfort ; and now was the time for a heroine , who had not yet played a very distinguished part in the events of the evening , to be noticed and admired .

text: Such words had their due effect ; she immediately thought the evening pleasanter than she had found it before — her humble vanity was contented — she felt more obliged to the two young men for this simple praise than a true quality heroine would have been for fifteen sonnets in celebration of her charms , and went to her chair in good humour with everybody , and perfectly satisfied with her share of public attention .
text_tokenized: Such words had their due effect ; she immediately thought the evening pleasanter than she had found it before — her humble vanity was contented — she felt more obliged to the two young men for this simple praise than a true quality heroine would have been for fifteen sonnets in celebration of her charms , and went to her chair in good humour with everybody , and perfectly satisfied with her share of public attention .

text: Every morning now brought its regular duties — shops were to be visited ; some new part of the town to be looked at ; and the Pump - room to be attended , where they paraded up and down for an hour , looking at everybody and speaking to no one .

text: The wish of a numerous acquaintance in Bath was still uppermost with Mrs. Allen , and she repeated it after every fresh proof , which every morning brought , of her knowing nobody at all .

text: His address was good , and Catherine felt herself in high luck .

text: After chatting some time on such matters as naturally arose from the objects around them , he suddenly addressed her with—“I have hitherto been very remiss , madam , in the proper attentions of a partner here ; I have not yet asked you how long you have been in Bath ; whether you were ever here before ; whether you have been at the Upper Rooms , the theatre , and the concert ; and how you like the place altogether .
text_tokenized: After chatting some time on such matters as naturally arose from the objects around them , he suddenly addressed her with—“I have hitherto been very remiss , madam , in the proper attentions of a partner here ; I have not yet asked you how long you have been in Bath ; whether you were ever here before ; whether you have been at the Upper Rooms , the theatre , and the concert ; and how you like the place altogether .

text: “ Yes , I know exactly what you will say : Friday , went to the Lower Rooms ; wore my sprigged muslin robe with blue trimmings — plain black shoes — appeared to much advantage ; but was strangely harassed by a queer , half - witted man , who would make me dance with him , and distressed me by his nonsense . ”
text_tokenized: “ Yes , I know exactly what you will say : Friday , went to the Lower Rooms ; wore my sprigged muslin robe with blue trimmings — plain black shoes — appeared to much advantage ; but was strangely harassed by a queer , half - witted man , who would make me dance with him , and distressed me by his nonsense . ”

text: “ Indeed I shall say no such thing . ” “ Shall I tell you what you ought to say ? ” “ If you please . ”
text_tokenized: “ Indeed I shall say no such thing . ” “ Shall I tell you what you ought to say ? ” “ If you please . ”

text: “ I danced with a very agreeable young man , introduced by Mr. King ; had a great deal of conversation with him — seems a most extraordinary genius — hope I may know more of him .
text_tokenized: “ I danced with a very agreeable young man , introduced by Mr. King ; had a great deal of conversation with him — seems a most extraordinary genius — hope I may know more of him .

text: _ That _ , madam , is what I _ wish _ you to say . ”
text_tokenized: _ That _ , madam , is what I _ wish _ you to say . ”

text: “ But , perhaps , I keep no journal . ”
text_tokenized: “ But , perhaps , I keep no journal . ”

text: “ Perhaps you are not sitting in this room , and I am not sitting by you .
text_tokenized: “ Perhaps you are not sitting in this room , and I am not sitting by you .

text: These are points in which a doubt is equally possible .
text_tokenized: These are points in which a doubt is equally possible .

text: Not keep a journal !
text_tokenized: Not keep a journal !

text: how are your absent cousins to understand the tenor of your life in Bath without one ?
text_tokenized: how are your absent cousins to understand the tenor of your life in Bath without one ?

text: How are the civilities and compliments of every day to be related as they ought to be , unless noted down every evening in a journal ?
text_tokenized: How are the civilities and compliments of every day to be related as they ought to be , unless noted down every evening in a journal ?

text: How are your various dresses to be remembered , and the particular state of your complexion , and curl of your hair to be described in all their diversities , without having constant recourse to a journal ?
text_tokenized: How are your various dresses to be remembered , and the particular state of your complexion , and curl of your hair to be described in all their diversities , without having constant recourse to a journal ?

text: My dear madam , I am not so ignorant of young ladies ’ ways as you wish to believe me ; it is this delightful habit of journaling which largely contributes to form the easy style of writing for which ladies are so generally celebrated .
text_tokenized: My dear madam , I am not so ignorant of young ladies ’ ways as you wish to believe me ; it is this delightful habit of journaling which largely contributes to form the easy style of writing for which ladies are so generally celebrated .

text: Everybody allows that the talent of writing agreeable letters is peculiarly female .
text_tokenized: Everybody allows that the talent of writing agreeable letters is peculiarly female .

text: Nature may have done something , but I am sure it must be essentially assisted by the practice of keeping a journal .
text_tokenized: Nature may have done something , but I am sure it must be essentially assisted by the practice of keeping a journal .

text: “ I have sometimes thought , ” said Catherine , doubtingly , “ whether ladies do write so much better letters than gentlemen !
text_tokenized: “ I have sometimes thought , ” said Catherine , doubtingly , “ whether ladies do write so much better letters than gentlemen !

text: that is — I should not think the superiority was always on our side . ”
text_tokenized: that is — I should not think the superiority was always on our side . ”

text: “ As far as I have had opportunity of judging , it appears to me that the usual style of letter - writing among women is faultless , except in three particulars . ” “ And what are they ?
text_tokenized: “ As far as I have had opportunity of judging , it appears to me that the usual style of letter - writing among women is faultless , except in three particulars . ” “ And what are they ?

text: “ A general deficiency of subject , a total inattention to stops , and a very frequent ignorance of grammar . ”
text_tokenized: “ A general deficiency of subject , a total inattention to stops , and a very frequent ignorance of grammar . ”

text: “ Upon my word !
text_tokenized: “ Upon my word !

text: i need not have been afraid of disclaiming the compliment .
text_tokenized: i need not have been afraid of disclaiming the compliment .

text: You do not think too highly of us in that way . ” “ I should no more lay it down as a general rule that women write better letters than men , than that they sing better duets , or draw better landscapes .
text_tokenized: You do not think too highly of us in that way . ” “ I should no more lay it down as a general rule that women write better letters than men , than that they sing better duets , or draw better landscapes .

text: In every power , of which taste is the foundation , excellence is pretty fairly divided between the sexes . ”
text_tokenized: In every power , of which taste is the foundation , excellence is pretty fairly divided between the sexes . ”

text: They were interrupted by Mrs. Allen :
text_tokenized: They were interrupted by Mrs. Allen :

text: “ My dear Catherine , ” said she , “ do take this pin out of my sleeve ; I am afraid it has torn a hole already ; I shall be quite sorry if it has , for this is a favourite gown , though it cost but nine shillings a yard .
text_tokenized: “ My dear Catherine , ” said she , “ do take this pin out of my sleeve ; I am afraid it has torn a hole already ; I shall be quite sorry if it has , for this is a favourite gown , though it cost but nine shillings a yard .

text: “ That is exactly what I should have guessed it , madam , ” said Mr. Tilney , looking at the muslin .
text_tokenized: “ That is exactly what I should have guessed it , madam , ” said Mr. Tilney , looking at the muslin .

text: “ Do you understand muslins , sir ? ”
text_tokenized: “ Do you understand muslins , sir ? ”

text: “ Particularly well ; I always buy my own cravats , and am allowed to be an excellent judge ; and my sister has often trusted me in the choice of a gown .
text_tokenized: “ Particularly well ; I always buy my own cravats , and am allowed to be an excellent judge ; and my sister has often trusted me in the choice of a gown .

text: I bought one for her the other day , and it was pronounced to be a prodigious bargain by every lady who saw it .
text_tokenized: I bought one for her the other day , and it was pronounced to be a prodigious bargain by every lady who saw it .

text: I gave but five shillings a yard for it , and a true Indian muslin . ”
text_tokenized: I gave but five shillings a yard for it , and a true Indian muslin . ”

text: Mrs. Allen was quite struck by his genius .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Allen was quite struck by his genius .

text: “ Men commonly take so little notice of those things , ” said she ; “ I can never get Mr. Allen to know one of my gowns from another .
text_tokenized: “ Men commonly take so little notice of those things , ” said she ; “ I can never get Mr. Allen to know one of my gowns from another .

text: You must be a great comfort to your sister , sir . ”
text_tokenized: You must be a great comfort to your sister , sir . ”

text: “ I hope I am , madam . ”
text_tokenized: “ I hope I am , madam . ”

text: “ And pray , sir , what do you think of Miss Morland ’s gown ? ” “ It is very pretty , madam , ” said he , gravely examining it ; “ but I do not think it will wash well ; I am afraid it will fray . ”
text_tokenized: “ And pray , sir , what do you think of Miss Morland ’s gown ? ” “ It is very pretty , madam , ” said he , gravely examining it ; “ but I do not think it will wash well ; I am afraid it will fray . ”

text: “ How can you , ” said Catherine , laughing , “ be so — ”
text_tokenized: “ How can you , ” said Catherine , laughing , “ be so — ”

text: She had almost said “ strange . ”
text_tokenized: She had almost said “ strange . ”

text: “ I am quite of your opinion , sir , ” replied Mrs. Allen ; “ and so I told Miss Morland when she bought it . ”
text_tokenized: “ I am quite of your opinion , sir , ” replied Mrs. Allen ; “ and so I told Miss Morland when she bought it . ”

text: “ But then you know , madam , muslin always turns to some account or other ; Miss Morland will get enough out of it for a handkerchief , or a cap , or a cloak .
text_tokenized: “ But then you know , madam , muslin always turns to some account or other ; Miss Morland will get enough out of it for a handkerchief , or a cap , or a cloak .

text: Muslin can never be said to be wasted .
text_tokenized: Muslin can never be said to be wasted .

text: I have heard my sister say so forty times , when she has been extravagant in buying more than she wanted , or careless in cutting it to pieces . ”
text_tokenized: I have heard my sister say so forty times , when she has been extravagant in buying more than she wanted , or careless in cutting it to pieces . ”

text: “ Bath is a charming place , sir ; there are so many good shops here .
text_tokenized: “ Bath is a charming place , sir ; there are so many good shops here .

text: We are sadly off in the country ; not but what we have very good shops in Salisbury , but it is so far to go — eight miles is a long way ; Mr. Allen says it is nine , measured nine ; but I am sure it can not be more than eight ; and it is such a fag — I come back tired to death .
text_tokenized: We are sadly off in the country ; not but what we have very good shops in Salisbury , but it is so far to go — eight miles is a long way ; Mr. Allen says it is nine , measured nine ; but I am sure it can not be more than eight ; and it is such a fag — I come back tired to death .

text: Now , here one can step out of doors and get a thing in five minutes .
text_tokenized: Now , here one can step out of doors and get a thing in five minutes .

text: Mr. Tilney was polite enough to seem interested in what she said ; and she kept him on the subject of muslins till the dancing recommenced .
text_tokenized: Mr. Tilney was polite enough to seem interested in what she said ; and she kept him on the subject of muslins till the dancing recommenced .

text: Catherine feared , as she listened to their discourse , that he indulged himself a little too much with the foibles of others .
text_tokenized: Catherine feared , as she listened to their discourse , that he indulged himself a little too much with the foibles of others .

text: “ What are you thinking of so earnestly ? ” said he , as they walked back to the ballroom ; “ not of your partner , I hope , for , by that shake of the head , your meditations are not satisfactory . ”
text_tokenized: “ What are you thinking of so earnestly ? ” said he , as they walked back to the ballroom ; “ not of your partner , I hope , for , by that shake of the head , your meditations are not satisfactory . ”

text: Catherine coloured , and said , “ I was not thinking of anything . ”
text_tokenized: Catherine coloured , and said , “ I was not thinking of anything . ”

text: “ That is artful and deep , to be sure ; but I had rather be told at once that you will not tell me . ”
text_tokenized: “ That is artful and deep , to be sure ; but I had rather be told at once that you will not tell me . ”

text: “ Well then , I will not . ”
text_tokenized: “ Well then , I will not . ”

text: “ Thank you ; for now we shall soon be acquainted , as I am authorized to tease you on this subject whenever we meet , and nothing in the world advances intimacy so much .
text_tokenized: “ Thank you ; for now we shall soon be acquainted , as I am authorized to tease you on this subject whenever we meet , and nothing in the world advances intimacy so much .

text: They danced again ; and , when the assembly closed , parted , on the lady ’s side at least , with a strong inclination for continuing the acquaintance .
text_tokenized: They danced again ; and , when the assembly closed , parted , on the lady ’s side at least , with a strong inclination for continuing the acquaintance .

text: for if it be true , as a celebrated writer has maintained , that no young lady can be justified in falling in love before the gentleman ’s love is declared,[1 ] it must be very improper that a young lady should dream of a gentleman before the gentleman is first known to have dreamt of her .
text_tokenized: for if it be true , as a celebrated writer has maintained , that no young lady can be justified in falling in love before the gentleman ’s love is declared,[1 ] it must be very improper that a young lady should dream of a gentleman before the gentleman is first known to have dreamt of her .

text: How proper Mr. Tilney might be as a dreamer or a lover had not yet perhaps entered Mr. Allen ’s head , but that he was not objectionable as a common acquaintance for his young charge he was on inquiry satisfied ; for he had early in the evening taken pains to know who her partner was , and had been assured of Mr. Tilney ’s being a clergyman , and of a very respectable family in Gloucestershire
